definition: to climb step by step/to rise steadily/on the up and up
surname Bu
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation
surname Bu
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation
high/tall/above average/loud/your (honorific)
surname Gao
to ascend/to rise to the rank of/to promote/to hoist/liter/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth dou 斗[dou3]
variant of 升[sheng1]
variant of 升[sheng1]/to ascend/to rise in rank

sentences.english: I hope there will be a promotion for you this year.
Mr. Wang has risen in his profession over the past five years.
sentences.chinese: 过去五年中，王先生在他专业里，步步高升。

sentences.english: In the light of his aptitude, personality and diligence, he will surly be promoted soon.
sentences.chinese: 他能力强，人品好，办事勤快，显然会步步高升的。

sentences.english: He hopes to move onward and upward with his current company.
sentences.chinese: 他希望能在现在就职之公司里顺利发展，步步高升。

sentences.english: By aptitude, personality and work he is obviously slated to go up.
sentences.chinese: 他有才能，人品好，办事勤奋，显然会步步高升。

definition: to rapidly go up in the world/meteoric rise (of a career, social position etc)
(of a political career) everything is going smoothly (idiom)
rising straight up in a clear sky (idiom); rapid promotion to a high post/meteoric career
lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
profits pouring in from all sides (idiom)/raking in money/bonanza
to be promoted and gain wealth (idiom)
the time comes, fortune turns (idiom); to have a lucky break/things change for the better
to get a promotion
riches and honor
everything is going smoothly (idiom)
to have all one's wishes (idiom)/best wishes/all the best/may all your hopes be fulfilled
lucky star in the ascendant (idiom); a lucky sign
ushering in wealth and prosperity (idiom and traditional greeting, esp. at New Year); We wish you wealth and success!
good luck
to get promoted
becoming more prosperous with each passing day
